speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: SCENE III. A room in LEONTES' palace.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Enter LEONTES, ANTIGONUS, Lords, and Servants

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Nor night nor day no rest: it is but weakness

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To bear the matter thus; mere weakness. If

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The cause were not in being,--part o' the cause,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: She the adulteress; for the harlot king

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Is quite beyond mine arm, out of the blank

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And level of my brain, plot-proof; but she

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I can hook to me: say that she were gone,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Given to the fire, a moiety of my rest

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Might come to me again. Who's there?

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: My lord?

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: How does the boy?

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: He took good rest to-night;

speaker: First Servant
text_entry: 'Tis hoped his sickness is discharged.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To see his nobleness!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Conceiving the dishonour of his mother,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: He straight declined, droop'd, took it deeply,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Fasten'd and fix'd the shame on't in himself,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Threw off his spirit, his appetite, his sleep,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And downright languish'd. Leave me solely: go,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: See how he fares.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exit Servant

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Fie, fie! no thought of him:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The thought of my revenges that way

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Recoil upon me: in himself too mighty,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And in his parties, his alliance; let him be

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Until a time may serve: for present vengeance,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Take it on her. Camillo and Polixenes

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Laugh at me, make their pastime at my sorrow:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: They should not laugh if I could reach them, nor

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Shall she within my power.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Enter PAULINA, with a child

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: You must not enter.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Nay, rather, good my lords, be second to me:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Fear you his tyrannous passion more, alas,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Than the queen's life? a gracious innocent soul,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: More free than he is jealous.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: That's enough.

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: Madam, he hath not slept tonight; commanded

speaker: Second Servant
text_entry: None should come at him.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Not so hot, good sir:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I come to bring him sleep. 'Tis such as you,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: That creep like shadows by him and do sigh

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: At each his needless heavings, such as you

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Nourish the cause of his awaking: I

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Do come with words as medicinal as true,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Honest as either, to purge him of that humour

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: That presses him from sleep.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What noise there, ho?

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: No noise, my lord; but needful conference

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: About some gossips for your highness.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: How!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Away with that audacious lady! Antigonus,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I charged thee that she should not come about me:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I knew she would.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I told her so, my lord,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: On your displeasure's peril and on mine,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: She should not visit you.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: What, canst not rule her?

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: From all dishonesty he can: in this,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Unless he take the course that you have done,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Commit me for committing honour, trust it,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: He shall not rule me.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: La you now, you hear:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: When she will take the rein I let her run;

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: But she'll not stumble.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Good my liege, I come;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And, I beseech you, hear me, who profess

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Myself your loyal servant, your physician,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Your most obedient counsellor, yet that dare

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Less appear so in comforting your evils,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Than such as most seem yours: I say, I come

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: From your good queen.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Good queen!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Good queen, my lord,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Good queen; I say good queen;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And would by combat make her good, so were I

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: A man, the worst about you.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Force her hence.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Let him that makes but trifles of his eyes

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: First hand me: on mine own accord I'll off;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: But first I'll do my errand. The good queen,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: For she is good, hath brought you forth a daughter;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Here 'tis; commends it to your blessing.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Laying down the child

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Out!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A mankind witch! Hence with her, out o' door:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A most intelligencing bawd!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Not so:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I am as ignorant in that as you

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: In so entitling me, and no less honest

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Than you are mad; which is enough, I'll warrant,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As this world goes, to pass for honest.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Traitors!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Will you not push her out? Give her the bastard.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou dotard! thou art woman-tired, unroosted

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: By thy dame Partlet here. Take up the bastard;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Take't up, I say; give't to thy crone.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: For ever

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Unvenerable be thy hands, if thou

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Takest up the princess by that forced baseness

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Which he has put upon't!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: He dreads his wife.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So I would you did; then 'twere past all doubt

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You'ld call your children yours.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A nest of traitors!

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I am none, by this good light.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Nor I, nor any

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: But one that's here, and that's himself, for he

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The sacred honour of himself, his queen's,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: His hopeful son's, his babe's, betrays to slander,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Whose sting is sharper than the sword's;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: and will not--

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: For, as the case now stands, it is a curse

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: He cannot be compell'd to't--once remove

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The root of his opinion, which is rotten

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: As ever oak or stone was sound.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A callat

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of boundless tongue, who late hath beat her husband

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And now baits me! This brat is none of mine;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: It is the issue of Polixenes:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Hence with it, and together with the dam

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Commit them to the fire!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: It is yours;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And, might we lay the old proverb to your charge,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So like you, 'tis the worse. Behold, my lords,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Although the print be little, the whole matter

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And copy of the father, eye, nose, lip,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The trick of's frown, his forehead, nay, the valley,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The pretty dimples of his chin and cheek,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: His smiles,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The very mould and frame of hand, nail, finger:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: And thou, good goddess Nature, which hast made it

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So like to him that got it, if thou hast

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: The ordering of the mind too, 'mongst all colours

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: No yellow in't, lest she suspect, as he does,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Her children not her husband's!

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A gross hag

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And, lozel, thou art worthy to be hang'd,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That wilt not stay her tongue.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Hang all the husbands

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: That cannot do that feat, you'll leave yourself

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Hardly one subject.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Once more, take her hence.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: A most unworthy and unnatural lord

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Can do no more.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I'll ha' thee burnt.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I care not:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: It is an heretic that makes the fire,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Not she which burns in't. I'll not call you tyrant;

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: But this most cruel usage of your queen,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Not able to produce more accusation

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Than your own weak-hinged fancy, something savours

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Of tyranny and will ignoble make you,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Yea, scandalous to the world.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: On your allegiance,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Out of the chamber with her! Were I a tyrant,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where were her life? she durst not call me so,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: If she did know me one. Away with her!

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: I pray you, do not push me; I'll be gone.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Look to your babe, my lord; 'tis yours:

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Jove send her

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: A better guiding spirit! What needs these hands?

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: You, that are thus so tender o'er his follies,

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Will never do him good, not one of you.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: So, so: farewell; we are gone.

speaker: PAULINA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou, traitor, hast set on thy wife to this.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My child? away with't! Even thou, that hast

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A heart so tender o'er it, take it hence

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And see it instantly consumed with fire;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Even thou and none but thou. Take it up straight:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Within this hour bring me word 'tis done,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And by good testimony, or I'll seize thy life,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: With what thou else call'st thine. If thou refuse

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And wilt encounter with my wrath, say so;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The bastard brains with these my proper hands

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Shall I dash out. Go, take it to the fire;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: For thou set'st on thy wife.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I did not, sir:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: These lords, my noble fellows, if they please,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Can clear me in't.

speaker: Lords
text_entry: We can: my royal liege,

speaker: Lords
text_entry: He is not guilty of her coming hither.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: You're liars all.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Beseech your highness, give us better credit:

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: We have always truly served you, and beseech you

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: So to esteem of us, and on our knees we beg,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: As recompense of our dear services

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Past and to come, that you do change this purpose,

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Which being so horrible, so bloody, must

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Lead on to some foul issue: we all kneel.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: I am a feather for each wind that blows:

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Shall I live on to see this bastard kneel

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And call me father? better burn it now

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Than curse it then. But be it; let it live.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: It shall not neither. You, sir, come you hither;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: You that have been so tenderly officious

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: With Lady Margery, your midwife there,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To save this bastard's life,--for 'tis a bastard,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: So sure as this beard's grey,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: --what will you adventure

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To save this brat's life?

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Any thing, my lord,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: That my ability may undergo

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: And nobleness impose: at least thus much:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I'll pawn the little blood which I have left

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: To save the innocent: any thing possible.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: It shall be possible. Swear by this sword

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Thou wilt perform my bidding.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I will, my lord.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Mark and perform it, see'st thou! for the fail

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of any point in't shall not only be

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Death to thyself but to thy lewd-tongued wife,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Whom for this time we pardon. We enjoin thee,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: As thou art liege-man to us, that thou carry

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: This female bastard hence and that thou bear it

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: To some remote and desert place quite out

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Of our dominions, and that there thou leave it,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Without more mercy, to its own protection

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And favour of the climate. As by strange fortune

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: It came to us, I do in justice charge thee,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: On thy soul's peril and thy body's torture,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: That thou commend it strangely to some place

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Where chance may nurse or end it. Take it up.

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: I swear to do this, though a present death

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Had been more merciful. Come on, poor babe:

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Some powerful spirit instruct the kites and ravens

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: To be thy nurses! Wolves and bears, they say

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Casting their savageness aside have done

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Like offices of pity. Sir, be prosperous

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: In more than this deed does require! And blessing

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Against this cruelty fight on thy side,

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Poor thing, condemn'd to loss!

speaker: ANTIGONUS
text_entry: Exit with the child

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: No, I'll not rear

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Another's issue.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Enter a Servant

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Please your highness, posts

speaker: Servant
text_entry: From those you sent to the oracle are come

speaker: Servant
text_entry: An hour since: Cleomenes and Dion,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Being well arrived from Delphos, are both landed,

speaker: Servant
text_entry: Hasting to the court.

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: So please you, sir, their speed

speaker: First Lord
text_entry: Hath been beyond account.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Twenty-three days

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: They have been absent: 'tis good speed; foretells

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The great Apollo suddenly will have

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: The truth of this appear. Prepare you, lords;

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Summon a session, that we may arraign

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Our most disloyal lady, for, as she hath

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Been publicly accused, so shall she have

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: A just and open trial. While she lives

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: My heart will be a burthen to me. Leave me,

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: And think upon my bidding.

speaker: LEONTES
text_entry: Exeunt
